items.title: E-bike rider dies after garbage truck collision in Sydney
items.standfirst: T he man in his 30s died at the scene after the 6am crash at an Ultimo intersection.
items.content: An e-bike rider has died after a collision with a garbage truck in Sydney's CBD this morning.Emergency services were called to the intersection of Little Regent Street and George Street, near Railway Square, at about 6am. Paramedics treated the e-bike rider, a man aged in his 30s, but he died at the scene.READ MORE: Australia's happiest generation of workers revealed The truck driver, a 28-year-old man, was taken to hospital for mandatory testing.Police are investigating and a report will be prepared for the coroner.Motorists are advised to avoid the area this morning as traffic is affected.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.title: Man allegedly shoots crossbow at police in Melbourne
clusters.neutral_headline: Man Allegedly Shoots Crossbow at Police in Melbourne

items.content: A man has been charged after allegedly shooting a crossbow at police in Eltham, Melbourne.

items.title: Man allegedly shoots crossbow at police in Melbourne
items.standfirst: T he man is accused of shooting at officers after they cordoned off a property at Eltham.
items.content: A man is under arrest after allegedly shooting a crossbow at police in Melbourne's north-east yesterday.Officers attended an address in Reynolds Road, Eltham, at about 1.40pm after reports a man armed with a crossbow was behaving erratically.They attempted to contact the man but were unsuccessful.READ MORE: TGA issues fresh warning for Ozempic and other high-profile drugs Police cordoned off the property, and it's alleged the man came out from the back and loosed the crossbow at two officers.Police drew their guns and shots were fired at the man, who went back inside.The man was not physically injured and surrendered to police a short time later. The 26-year-old Eltham man has been charged with multiple offences, including assaulting police and reckless life-threatening conduct.He will appear in court today. An investigation into the incident is ongoing.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

The NDIS funding cuts are a concern for advocates.

clusters.title: 'Illusion of simplicity': Social media glosses over dangers of bushwalking
clusters.neutral_headline: Social media trends may impact bushwalking safety

items.title: 'Illusion of simplicity': Social media glosses over dangers of bushwalking
items.standfirst: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.
items.content: There are concerns that social media is leading to poor bushwalking decisions with trends such as "rawdogging" a hike glorifying a lack of preparedness.

The "rawdogging" trend glorifies lack of preparedness for hikes.
Concerns exist regarding the impact of social media on bushwalking safety.
Poor decisions may result from social media's influence on hikers.
The article highlights potential dangers associated with social media trends.

items.content: Mr Mangione, who was arrested in 2024, has been charged with fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in Midtown Manhattan.
